title: All Quiet on the Western Front

sources.title: All Quiet on the Western Front (1979)
sources.description: "All Quiet on the Western Front" (1979) is an anti-war television film directed by Delbert Mann, based on the novel by Erich Maria Remarque. It follows the story of Paul BÃ¤umer, a young German soldier who experiences the brutal realities of World War I, leading to profound disillusionment with the war.

metadata.Plot: Paul Baumer is a young German who, along with his graduating high school classmates, enlist in the German Imperial Army during the First World War. Originally thinking war would be a great adventure, Paul and his friends discover exactly the opposite as the war drags on and one by one the members of the class are killed in action until only Paul remains.
metadata.Actors: Richard Thomas, Ernest Borgnine, Donald Pleasence
metadata.Awards: Won 1 Primetime Emmy. 2 wins & 6 nominations total
